metadata.serviceFullName: Amazon Bedrock Agent Core Control Plane Fronting Layer

CreateApiKeyCredentialProvider.name: CreateApiKeyCredentialProvider
CreateApiKeyCredentialProvider.documentation: Creates a new API key credential provider.

CreateGateway.name: CreateGateway
CreateGateway.documentation:
Creates a gateway for Amazon Bedrock Agent. A gateway serves as an integration point between your agent and external services.

If you specify CUSTOM_JWT as the authorizerType, you must provide an authorizerConfiguration.

CreateGatewayTarget.name: CreateGatewayTarget
CreateGatewayTarget.documentation: Creates a target for a gateway. A target defines an endpoint that the gateway can connect to.

CreateMemory.name: CreateMemory
CreateMemory.documentation: Creates a new Amazon Bedrock AgentCore Memory resource.

DeleteMemory.name: DeleteMemory
DeleteMemory.documentation: Deletes an Amazon Bedrock AgentCore Memory resource.

GetAgentRuntimeEndpoint.name: GetAgentRuntimeEndpoint
GetAgentRuntimeEndpoint.documentation: Gets information about an Amazon Secure AgentEndpoint.

GetApiKeyCredentialProvider.name: GetApiKeyCredentialProvider
GetApiKeyCredentialProvider.documentation: Retrieves information about an API key credential provider.

GetCodeInterpreter.name: GetCodeInterpreter
GetCodeInterpreter.documentation: Gets information about a custom code interpreter.

GetGatewayTarget.name: GetGatewayTarget
GetGatewayTarget.documentation: Retrieves information about a specific gateway target.

GetMemory.name: GetMemory
GetMemory.documentation: Retrieve an existing Amazon Bedrock AgentCore Memory resource.

GetOauth2CredentialProvider.name: GetOauth2CredentialProvider
GetOauth2CredentialProvider.documentation: Retrieves information about an OAuth2 credential provider.

ListAgentRuntimeEndpoints.name: ListAgentRuntimeEndpoints
ListAgentRuntimeEndpoints.documentation: Lists all endpoints for a specific Amazon Secure Agent.

ListAgentRuntimeVersions.name: ListAgentRuntimeVersions
ListAgentRuntimeVersions.documentation: Lists all versions of a specific Amazon Secure Agent.

ListAgentRuntimes.name: ListAgentRuntimes
ListAgentRuntimes.documentation: Lists all Amazon Secure Agents in your account.

ListApiKeyCredentialProviders.name: ListApiKeyCredentialProviders
ListApiKeyCredentialProviders.documentation: Lists all API key credential providers in your account.

ListBrowsers.name: ListBrowsers
ListBrowsers.documentation: Lists all custom browsers in your account.

ListCodeInterpreters.name: ListCodeInterpreters
ListCodeInterpreters.documentation: Lists all custom code interpreters in your account.

ListGatewayTargets.name: ListGatewayTargets
ListGatewayTargets.documentation: Lists all targets for a specific gateway.

ListMemories.name: ListMemories
ListMemories.documentation: Lists the available Amazon Bedrock AgentCore Memory resources in the current Amazon Web Services Region.

ListOauth2CredentialProviders.name: ListOauth2CredentialProviders
ListOauth2CredentialProviders.documentation: Lists all OAuth2 credential providers in your account.

ListTagsForResource.name: ListTagsForResource
ListTagsForResource.documentation:
Lists the tags associated with the specified resource.

This feature is currently available only for AgentCore Runtime, Browser, Code Interpreter tool, and Gateway.

ListWorkloadIdentities.name: ListWorkloadIdentities
ListWorkloadIdentities.documentation: Lists all workload identities in your account.

SetTokenVaultCMK.name: SetTokenVaultCMK
SetTokenVaultCMK.documentation: Sets the customer master key (CMK) for a token vault.

TagResource.name: TagResource
TagResource.documentation:
Associates the specified tags to a resource with the specified resourceArn. If existing tags on a resource are not specified in the request parameters, they are not changed. When a resource is deleted, the tags associated with that resource are also deleted.

This feature is currently available only for AgentCore Runtime, Browser, Code Interpreter tool, and Gateway.

UntagResource.name: UntagResource
UntagResource.documentation:
Removes the specified tags from the specified resource.

This feature is currently available only for AgentCore Runtime, Browser, Code Interpreter tool, and Gateway.

UpdateAgentRuntimeEndpoint.name: UpdateAgentRuntimeEndpoint
UpdateAgentRuntimeEndpoint.documentation: Updates an existing Amazon Bedrock AgentCore Runtime endpoint.

UpdateApiKeyCredentialProvider.name: UpdateApiKeyCredentialProvider
UpdateApiKeyCredentialProvider.documentation: Updates an existing API key credential provider.

UpdateMemory.name: UpdateMemory
UpdateMemory.documentation: Update an Amazon Bedrock AgentCore Memory resource memory.

AccessDeniedException.documentation: This exception is thrown when a request is denied per access permissions

agentRuntimeArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the agent runtime.

agentRuntimeId.documentation: The unique identifier of the agent runtime.

lastUpdatedAt.documentation: The timestamp when the agent runtime was last updated.

status.documentation: The current status of the agent runtime.

AgentRuntime.documentation: Contains information about an agent runtime. An agent runtime is the execution environment for a Amazon Bedrock Agent.

containerConfiguration.documentation: The container configuration for the agent artifact.

name.documentation: The name of the agent runtime endpoint.

liveVersion.documentation: The live version of the agent runtime endpoint. This is the version that is currently serving requests.

targetVersion.documentation: The target version of the agent runtime endpoint. This is the version that the endpoint is being updated to.

agentRuntimeEndpointArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the agent runtime endpoint.

agentRuntimeArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the agent runtime associated with the endpoint.

status.documentation: The current status of the agent runtime endpoint.

id.documentation: The unique identifier of the agent runtime endpoint.

description.documentation: The description of the agent runtime endpoint.

createdAt.documentation: The timestamp when the agent runtime endpoint was created.

lastUpdatedAt.documentation: The timestamp when the agent runtime endpoint was last updated.

AgentRuntimeEndpoint.documentation: Contains information about an agent runtime endpoint. An endpoint provides a way to connect to and interact with an agent runtime.

providerArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the API key credential provider. This ARN identifies the provider in Amazon Web Services.

credentialParameterName.documentation: The name of the credential parameter for the API key. This parameter name is used when sending the API key to the target endpoint.

credentialPrefix.documentation: The prefix for the API key credential. This prefix is added to the API key when sending it to the target endpoint.

credentialLocation.documentation: The location of the API key credential. This field specifies where in the request the API key should be placed.

ApiKeyCredentialProvider.documentation: An API key credential provider for gateway authentication. This structure contains the configuration for authenticating with the target endpoint using an API key.

name.documentation: The name of the API key credential provider.

credentialProviderArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the API key credential provider.

createdTime.documentation: The timestamp when the API key credential provider was created.

lastUpdatedTime.documentation: The timestamp when the API key credential provider was last updated.

ApiKeyCredentialProviderItem.documentation: Contains information about an API key credential provider.

inlinePayload.documentation: The inline payload containing the API schema definition.

customJWTAuthorizer.documentation: The inbound JWT-based authorization, specifying how incoming requests should be authenticated.

AuthorizerConfiguration.documentation: Represents inbound authorization configuration options used to authenticate incoming requests.

networkMode.documentation: The network mode for the browser. This field specifies how the browser connects to the network.

BrowserNetworkConfiguration.documentation: The network configuration for a browser. This structure defines how the browser connects to the network.

browserArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the browser.

name.documentation: The name of the browser.

status.documentation: The current status of the browser.

createdAt.documentation: The timestamp when the browser was created.

lastUpdatedAt.documentation: The timestamp when the browser was last updated.

BrowserSummary.documentation: Contains summary information about a browser. A browser enables Amazon Bedrock Agent to interact with web content.

networkMode.documentation: The network mode for the code interpreter. This field specifies how the code interpreter connects to the network.

CodeInterpreterNetworkConfiguration.documentation: The network configuration for a code interpreter. This structure defines how the code interpreter connects to the network.

codeInterpreterId.documentation: The unique identifier of the code interpreter.

codeInterpreterArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the code interpreter.

name.documentation: The name of the code interpreter.

status.documentation: The current status of the code interpreter.

createdAt.documentation: The timestamp when the code interpreter was created.

lastUpdatedAt.documentation: The timestamp when the code interpreter was last updated.

CodeInterpreterSummary.documentation: Contains summary information about a code interpreter. A code interpreter enables Amazon Bedrock Agent to execute code.

ConcurrentModificationException.documentation: Exception thrown when a resource is modified concurrently by multiple requests.

ConflictException.documentation: This exception is thrown when there is a conflict performing an operation

ConsolidationConfiguration.documentation: Contains consolidation configuration information for a memory strategy.

agentRuntimeId.documentation: The unique identifier of the AgentCore Runtime to create an endpoint for.

name.documentation: The name of the AgentCore Runtime endpoint.

agentRuntimeVersion.documentation: The version of the AgentCore Runtime to use for the endpoint.

description.documentation: The description of the AgentCore Runtime endpoint.

clientToken.documentation: A unique, case-sensitive identifier to ensure idempotency of the request.

tags.documentation: A map of tag keys and values to assign to the agent runtime endpoint. Tags enable you to categorize your resources in different ways, for example, by purpose, owner, or environment.

targetVersion.documentation: The target version of the AgentCore Runtime for the endpoint.

agentRuntimeEndpointArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AgentCore Runtime endpoint.

agentRuntimeArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AgentCore Runtime.

status.documentation: The current status of the AgentCore Runtime endpoint.

createdAt.documentation: The timestamp when the AgentCore Runtime endpoint was created.

roleArn.documentation: The IAM role ARN that provides permissions for the AgentCore Runtime.

networkConfiguration.documentation: The network configuration for the AgentCore Runtime.

clientToken.documentation: A unique, case-sensitive identifier to ensure idempotency of the request.

authorizerConfiguration.documentation: The authorizer configuration for the AgentCore Runtime.

requestHeaderConfiguration.documentation: Configuration for HTTP request headers that will be passed through to the runtime.

lifecycleConfiguration.documentation: The life cycle configuration for the AgentCore Runtime.

environmentVariables.documentation: Environment variables to set in the AgentCore Runtime environment.

tags.documentation: A map of tag keys and values to assign to the agent runtime. Tags enable you to categorize your resources in different ways, for example, by purpose, owner, or environment.

agentRuntimeArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AgentCore Runtime.

workloadIdentityDetails.documentation: The workload identity details for the AgentCore Runtime.

agentRuntimeId.documentation: The unique identifier of the AgentCore Runtime.

createdAt.documentation: The timestamp when the AgentCore Runtime was created.

status.documentation: The current status of the AgentCore Runtime.

name.documentation: The name of the API key credential provider. The name must be unique within your account.

apiKey.documentation: The API key to use for authentication. This value is encrypted and stored securely.

apiKeySecretArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the secret containing the API key.

name.documentation: The name of the created API key credential provider.

credentialProviderArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the created API key credential provider.

name.documentation: The name of the browser. The name must be unique within your account.

executionRoleArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that provides permissions for the browser to access Amazon Web Services services.

networkConfiguration.documentation: The network configuration for the browser. This configuration specifies the network mode for the browser.

recording.documentation: The recording configuration for the browser. When enabled, browser sessions are recorded and stored in the specified Amazon S3 location.

clientToken.documentation: A unique, case-sensitive identifier to ensure that the operation completes no more than one time. If this token matches a previous request, Amazon Bedrock ignores the request but does not return an error.

tags.documentation: A map of tag keys and values to assign to the browser. Tags enable you to categorize your resources in different ways, for example, by purpose, owner, or environment.

browserId.documentation: The unique identifier of the created browser.

browserArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the created browser.

createdAt.documentation: The timestamp when the browser was created.

status.documentation: The current status of the browser.

name.documentation: The name of the code interpreter. The name must be unique within your account.

executionRoleArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that provides permissions for the code interpreter to access Amazon Web Services services.

networkConfiguration.documentation: The network configuration for the code interpreter. This configuration specifies the network mode for the code interpreter.

clientToken.documentation: A unique, case-sensitive identifier to ensure that the operation completes no more than one time. If this token matches a previous request, Amazon Bedrock ignores the request but does not return an error.

tags.documentation: A map of tag keys and values to assign to the code interpreter. Tags enable you to categorize your resources in different ways, for example, by purpose, owner, or environment.

codeInterpreterId.documentation: The unique identifier of the created code interpreter.

codeInterpreterArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the created code interpreter.

createdAt.documentation: The timestamp when the code interpreter was created.

status.documentation: The current status of the code interpreter.

name.documentation: The name of the gateway. The name must be unique within your account.

clientToken.documentation: A unique, case-sensitive identifier to ensure that the API request completes no more than one time. If you don't specify this field, a value is randomly generated for you. If this token matches a previous request, the service ignores the request, but doesn't return an error. For more information, see Ensuring idempotency.

roleArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that provides permissions for the gateway to access Amazon Web Services services.

protocolConfiguration.documentation: The configuration settings for the protocol specified in the protocolType parameter.

authorizerType.documentation:
The type of authorizer to use for the gateway.

  • CUSTOM_JWT - Authorize with a bearer token.

  • AWS_IAM - Authorize with your Amazon Web Services IAM credentials.

authorizerConfiguration.documentation: The authorizer configuration for the gateway. Required if authorizerType is CUSTOM_JWT.

kmsKeyArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the KMS key used to encrypt data associated with the gateway.

exceptionLevel.documentation:
The level of detail in error messages returned when invoking the gateway.

  • If the value is DEBUG, granular exception messages are returned to help a user debug the gateway.

  • If the value is omitted, a generic error message is returned to the end user.

tags.documentation: A map of key-value pairs to associate with the gateway as metadata tags.

gatewayArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the created gateway.

gatewayId.documentation: The unique identifier of the created gateway.

gatewayUrl.documentation: The URL endpoint for the created gateway.

createdAt.documentation: The timestamp when the gateway was created.

updatedAt.documentation: The timestamp when the gateway was last updated.

status.documentation: The current status of the gateway.

statusReasons.documentation: The reasons for the current status of the gateway.

name.documentation: The name of the gateway.

roleArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role associated with the gateway.

protocolConfiguration.documentation: The configuration settings for the protocol used by the gateway.

authorizerType.documentation: The type of authorizer used by the gateway.

authorizerConfiguration.documentation: The authorizer configuration for the created gateway.

kmsKeyArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the KMS key used to encrypt data associated with the gateway.

workloadIdentityDetails.documentation: The workload identity details for the created gateway.

exceptionLevel.documentation:
The level of detail in error messages returned when invoking the gateway.

  • If the value is DEBUG, granular exception messages are returned to help a user debug the gateway.

  • If the value is omitted, a generic error message is returned to the end user.

gatewayIdentifier.documentation: The identifier of the gateway to create a target for.

name.documentation: The name of the gateway target. The name must be unique within the gateway.

clientToken.documentation: A unique, case-sensitive identifier to ensure that the API request completes no more than one time. If you don't specify this field, a value is randomly generated for you. If this token matches a previous request, the service ignores the request, but doesn't return an error. For more information, see Ensuring idempotency.

targetConfiguration.documentation: The configuration settings for the target, including endpoint information and schema definitions.

credentialProviderConfigurations.documentation: The credential provider configurations for the target. These configurations specify how the gateway authenticates with the target endpoint.

gatewayArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the gateway.

targetId.documentation: The unique identifier of the created target.

createdAt.documentation: The timestamp when the target was created.

updatedAt.documentation: The timestamp when the target was last updated.

status.documentation: The current status of the target.

statusReasons.documentation: The reasons for the current status of the target.

name.documentation: The name of the target.

credentialProviderConfigurations.documentation: The credential provider configurations for the target.

clientToken.documentation: A unique, case-sensitive identifier to ensure that the operation completes no more than one time. If this token matches a previous request, Amazon Bedrock ignores the request but does not return an error.

name.documentation: The name of the memory. The name must be unique within your account.

encryptionKeyArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the KMS key used to encrypt the memory data.

memoryExecutionRoleArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that provides permissions for the memory to access Amazon Web Services services.

eventExpiryDuration.documentation: The duration after which memory events expire. Specified as an ISO 8601 duration.

memoryStrategies.documentation: The memory strategies to use for this memory. Strategies define how information is extracted, processed, and consolidated.

tags.documentation: A map of tag keys and values to assign to an AgentCore Memory. Tags enable you to categorize your resources in different ways, for example, by purpose, owner, or environment.

memory.documentation: The details of the created memory, including its ID, ARN, name, description, and configuration settings.

name.documentation: The name of the OAuth2 credential provider. The name must be unique within your account.

credentialProviderVendor.documentation: The vendor of the OAuth2 credential provider. This specifies which OAuth2 implementation to use.

oauth2ProviderConfigInput.documentation: The configuration settings for the OAuth2 provider, including client ID, client secret, and other vendor-specific settings.

clientSecretArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the client secret in AWS Secrets Manager.

name.documentation: The name of the OAuth2 credential provider.

credentialProviderArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the OAuth2 credential provider.

name.documentation: The name of the workload identity. The name must be unique within your account.

allowedResourceOauth2ReturnUrls.documentation: The list of allowed OAuth2 return URLs for resources associated with this workload identity.

name.documentation: The name of the workload identity.

workloadIdentityArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the workload identity.

allowedResourceOauth2ReturnUrls.documentation: The list of allowed OAuth2 return URLs for resources associated with this workload identity.

oauthCredentialProvider.documentation: The OAuth credential provider. This provider uses OAuth authentication to access the target endpoint.

apiKeyCredentialProvider.documentation: The API key credential provider. This provider uses an API key to authenticate with the target endpoint.

CredentialProvider.documentation: A credential provider for gateway authentication. This structure contains the configuration for authenticating with the target endpoint.

credentialProviderType.documentation: The type of credential provider. This field specifies which authentication method the gateway uses.

credentialProvider.documentation: The credential provider. This field contains the specific configuration for the credential provider type.

CredentialProviderConfiguration.documentation: The configuration for a credential provider. This structure defines how the gateway authenticates with the target endpoint.

semanticOverride.documentation: The semantic override configuration for a custom memory strategy.

summaryOverride.documentation: The summary override configuration for a custom memory strategy.

userPreferenceOverride.documentation: The user preference override configuration for a custom memory strategy.

selfManagedConfiguration.documentation: The self managed configuration for a custom memory strategy.

CustomConfigurationInput.documentation: Input for custom configuration of a memory strategy.

userPreferenceConsolidationOverride.documentation: The user preference consolidation override configuration input.

userPreferenceExtractionOverride.documentation: The user preference extraction override configuration input.

discoveryUrl.documentation: This URL is used to fetch OpenID Connect configuration or authorization server metadata for validating incoming tokens.

allowedAudience.documentation: Represents individual audience values that are validated in the incoming JWT token validation process.

allowedClients.documentation: Represents individual client IDs that are validated in the incoming JWT token validation process.

CustomJWTAuthorizerConfiguration.documentation: Configuration for inbound JWT-based authorization, specifying how incoming requests should be authenticated.

name.documentation: The name of the custom memory strategy.

description.documentation: The description of the custom memory strategy.

namespaces.documentation: The namespaces associated with the custom memory strategy.

configuration.documentation: The configuration for the custom memory strategy.

CustomMemoryStrategyInput.documentation: Input for creating a custom memory strategy.

oauthDiscovery.documentation: The OAuth2 discovery information for the custom provider.

clientId.documentation: The client ID for the custom OAuth2 provider.

clientSecret.documentation: The client secret for the custom OAuth2 provider.

CustomOauth2ProviderConfigInput.documentation: Input configuration for a custom OAuth2 provider.

oauthDiscovery.documentation: The OAuth2 discovery information for the custom provider.

CustomOauth2ProviderConfigOutput.documentation: Output configuration for a custom OAuth2 provider.

DecryptionFailure.documentation: Exception thrown when decryption of a secret fails.

idleRuntimeSessionTimeout.documentation: Timeout in seconds for idle runtime sessions. When a session remains idle for this duration, it will be automatically terminated. Default: 900 seconds (15 minutes).

maxLifetime.documentation: Maximum lifetime for the instance in seconds. Once reached, instances will be automatically terminated and replaced. Default: 28800 seconds (8 hours).

LifecycleConfiguration.documentation: LifecycleConfiguration lets you manage the lifecycle of runtime sessions and resources in AgentCore Runtime. This configuration helps optimize resource utilization by automatically cleaning up idle sessions and preventing long-running instances from consuming resources indefinitely.

Welcome to the Amazon Bedrock AgentCore Control plane API reference. Control plane actions configure, create, modify, and monitor Amazon Web Services resources.
